Header: Compensationfor public and private property damaged during the tense situation in Negombo
Content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has instructed that compensation be paid for public and private property that were damaged during yesterday’s tense situation in Negombo after assessing the damage. This is mentioned in a statement issued by the Prime Minister’s Office. Compensation is to be paid after conducting an assessment in order to estimate the damages caused to both public and private property. The statement issued by the Prime Minister’s office said that these funds would be disbursed by the Ministry of National Policies, Economic Affairs, Resettlement and Rehabilitation, Northern Province Development and Youth Affairs. Measures to assess the damages will also be undertaken by these ministries which fall under the purview of the Prime Minister. The situation that erupted in the area has been brought under total control.
